intro: Senecio liangshanensis, commonly known as the Liangshan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically found in the Liangshan region of Sichuan Province. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio liangshanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
